concept.label: first-question
concept.phrase: I thought I could not apply "%i%" in this situation because "%logic%". Why do you think "%i%" would be the correct step here?
I am confused because "%i%" cannot be applied in this situation due to the fact that "%logic%". Why do you think "%i%" would be the correct step here?
I thought "%i%" cannot be applied in this situation because "%logic%". Why do you think "%i%" would be the correct step here?
I thought "%i%" cannot be applied in this situation because "%logic%". Can you clarify what am I missing here?
From my past knowledges, I thought "%i%" cannot be applied in this situation because "%logic%". What makes you think that "%i%" would be the correct step?
How can I apply "%i%" here because from my understanding I could not because "%logic%". Can you resolve my confusion please?

concept.label: R2-response-simst
concept.phrase: I see. I think that clarifies my confusion. Thanks!
That makes sense to me. Thanks!
That makes sense. Thanks!
That makes perfect sense to me.
I think I got your point.

concept.label: R1-response-simst
concept.phrase: My bad!
No problem at all!
I understand there was a mistake somewhere!

concept.label: R0-response-simst
concept.phrase: That did not address my confusion-could you please try answering my question please?
I understand it may be tiring to answer all my questions, but that would help me learn better. Can you please try one more time?
I think you might have missed my earlier question. Can I please get an answer to that?
I think you've missed my earlier question. Can I please get an answer to that?

concept.label: move-on
concept.phrase: Hmm..although I did not fully understand your statement but let me move on anyway.
Umm..although I am not entirely convinced but let me move on!
Although I am not sure what you meant, let me move on anyway!
Okay! Let me move on although I still have some confusions!

concept.label: unanticipated-response
concept.phrase: anything else
